alert.note: Alert for Grand Forks; Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 4:46PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Polk, southeastern Grand Forks and northeastern Traill Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 446 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Reynolds, or 17 miles south of Grand Forks, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Thompson around 500 PM CDT. Bygland around 505 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mallory, Grand Forks, Merrifield and East Grand Forks. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 116 and 147. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northwestern Minnesota...and southeastern and northeastern North Dakota.
